results.question: If my car is stolen, what case will it be in law?
results.answer: Information not found in the document.

results.question: If I am arrested without a warrant, is that legal?
results.answer: Information not found in the document.

results.question: If someone denies me a job because of my caste, is that legal?
results.answer: Information not found in the document.

results.question: If the government takes my land for a project, can I stop it?
results.answer: You cannot be deprived of your property except by the authority of law.

results.question: If my child is forced to work in a factory, is that legal?
results.answer: No child below the age of fourteen years shall be employed to work in any factory or mine or engaged in any other hazardous employment.

results.question: If I am stopped from speaking at a protest, is that a violation of my rights?
results.answer: Article 19(1)(a) guarantees the right to freedom of speech and expression, but this right can be subjected to reasonable restrictions outlined in Article 19(2).

results.question: If a religious place stops me from entering because of my caste, what can I do?
results.answer: You can take action under Article 15 which prohibits discrimination on grounds of caste with respect to access to places of public resort maintained wholly or partly out of State funds or dedicated to the use of the general public.

results.question: If I change my religion, can the government stop me?
results.answer: No, nothing in Article 25 of the Constitution of India shall affect the operation of any existing law or prevent the State from making any law regulating or restricting any economic, financial, political or other secular activity associated with religious practice or providing for social welfare and reform or the throwing open of Hindu religious institutions of a public character to all classes and sections of Hindus.

results.question: If the police torture someone in custody, what right is violated?
results.answer: The right to freedom from torture in custody is violated when police torture someone.

results.question: If I'm denied admission to a public university because of my caste, what law applies?
results.answer: No citizen shall be denied admission into any educational institution maintained by the State or receiving aid out of State funds on grounds only of religion, race, caste, language or any of them.
